Loyalty. It’s a…complicated concept. Often misunderstood. People speak of it as a virtue, a noble quality. And it can be, I suppose. But in my world, loyalty isn’t about blind devotion. It’s about strategic alignment.

But Cecily’s advice liberated me. It allowed me to accept the inherent flaws of human nature. It taught me to be pragmatic, to be strategic, and to protect myself.

It wasn’t about becoming heartless, darling. It was about becoming realistic. It was about understanding that you can’t control other people’s actions, but you can control your reaction to them.

And sometimes, the best reaction is not forgiveness or understanding. Sometimes, the best reaction is a carefully calculated act of…justice.

It’s a lesson I’ve applied countless times throughout my life. And it has served me well.
